items.markdown:
Mobile problem is noted.

For the core map, we're trying to keep it generic to all events. So we're unlikely to support paths, we don't have a map that could efficiently create a route path either as the map logic (which roads are where) is actually disconnected from the display of the map (render tiles).

The way I was going to approach this to begin with is to simply say: the event represents the meetup time and location, and leave route sharing up to you, but if you put a URL in to a common route engine (bikely, mapmyride, etc), we'll also embed the route.

*IF* we ever add routes, we probably still wouldn't add route profiles, have cycle specific maps, etc. Hence encouraging you to use specialised tools for those tasks.

Our intent is only ever to cover the first 80% of functionality for a given type of content... and not to over-specialise. Hence if we add auctions you won't see dutch auctions, and adding maps to events doesn't show routes or marshal waypoints, etc.
